intro: Machaerium brachycarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several small, rounded seeds. Machaerium brachycarpum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
